prior_works.title: Finite Element Exterior Calculus: From Hodge Theory to Numerical Stability
prior_works.authors: Douglas N. Arnold, Richard S. Falk, Ragnar Winther
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Provided the mathematical backbone linking PDEs, differential forms, and stable finite element spaces, directly informing the paper’s design of k-form representations, coboundary operators, and boundary-aware losses for electromagnetism BVPs.

prior_works.title: Discrete Exterior Calculus
prior_works.authors: Mathieu Desbrun, Anil N. Hirani, Melvin Leok, Jerrold E. Marsden
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Supplied the discrete operators (exterior derivative, Hodge star, Stokes/Cartan structure) on meshes that the paper operationalizes as higher-order interactions, integrated-form estimators, and topology-aware message passing.

prior_works.title: Mixed finite elements in R3
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Established edge (and face) elements consistent with de Rham complexes, guiding the paper’s representation of electromagnetic fields as cochains/Whitney k-forms and its treatment of boundary conditions in BVPs.

prior_works.title: Simplicial Neural Networks
prior_works.authors: Gabriele E. Ebli, Michaël Defferrard, Gard Spreemann
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Demonstrated learning on oriented simplices via Hodge Laplacians and cochain signals, directly inspiring the use of differential-form-aware features and incidence-driven message passing in the proposed higher-order GNN.

prior_works.title: Cell Complex Neural Networks
prior_works.authors: Cristian Bodnar, Fabrizio Frasca, Nina Otter, Francesco Di Giovanni, Benjamin Chamberlain, Pietro Liò, Michael M. Bronstein
prior_works.role: Higher-order message passing on cell complexes
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Generalized GNNs to cell complexes with orientation and incidence structure; the paper builds on this paradigm but integrates FEEC/DEC operators to make the higher-order message passing physically and topologically faithful for PDEs.

prior_works.title: Fourier Neural Operator for Parametric Partial Differential Equations
prior_works.authors: Zongyi Li, Nikola Kovachki, Kamyar Azizzadenesheli, Burigede Liu, Kaushik Bhattacharya, Andrew Stuart, Anima Anandkumar
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Established neural operators as a framework for learning PDE solution maps; the current paper extends this line by replacing purely spectral/pointwise operators with topology- and form-aware higher-order interactions on meshes.

prior_works.title: Physics-Informed Neural Networks: A deep learning framework for solving forward and inverse problems involving nonlinear PDEs
prior_works.authors: Maziar Raissi, Paris Perdikaris, George E. Karniadakis
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Introduced physics-informed losses; the paper adapts this idea to differential-form/weak-integral constraints, crafting integrated losses that respect Stokes/Gauss laws within the FEEC/DEC framework.

synthesis_narrative:
The paper’s core contribution—a higher-order, differential topology-aware GNN for boundary-value PDEs—sits at the intersection of rigorous geometric numerics and modern neural operators. Foundationally, Finite Element Exterior Calculus (Arnold–Falk–Winther) provides the blueprint to encode PDE unknowns as differential forms, enforce boundary conditions along the de Rham complex, and ensure stability; Discrete Exterior Calculus (Desbrun–Hirani–Leok–Marsden) operationalizes these ideas on meshes via discrete exterior derivatives and Hodge stars. Nédélec’s mixed finite elements connect this theory to electromagnetism by prescribing edge/face elements (Whitney forms) that faithfully represent fields and their tangential/normal boundary conditions—key to the paper’s EM BVP instantiation.
On the learning side, Simplicial Neural Networks and Cell Complex Neural Networks showed how to carry signals on higher-dimensional cells with orientations and incidence-driven operators (Hodge Laplacians), directly motivating the paper’s cochain-level message passing and higher-order interactions. The work departs from generic neural operators such as the Fourier Neural Operator by embedding FEEC/DEC structure into the operator, thereby capturing the physical/topological meaning of higher-order mesh elements rather than treating them as mere graph connectivity. Finally, building on Physics-Informed Neural Networks, the authors craft losses in integrated (weak) form aligned with Stokes and Gauss laws, yielding physics-consistent training objectives and estimators of integral quantities. Together, these strands yield a neural operator that is both topology-aware and form-consistent, leading to strong performance on electromagnetic BVPs and offering a template for other PDEs with differential form formulations.
